intro: Guatteria australis var. pubens, commonly known as the pubescent guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes plants adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage, which gives it the "pubescent" variety name. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It produces small, white or pale green flowers followed by edible, fleshy berries that are often consumed by wildlife.
